channel.title: Multi Agression
channel.description: Alright, so I was trying to make a code for multi agression. I wanted to use random to make the npc choose a random person but that won't work. The problem is that it chooses the first person that is near and stays on that one, no matter what. I've been trying to find a way to make it choose the closest one, even if it has a target, so like making it change targets. The only way I can think of doing that is using the process() but that would cause a lot of lag. Is there any other way?

item.title: Multi Agression
item.dc:creator: @cocoa cocoa
item.description:
@cocoa wrote:

cocoa:

Alright, so I was trying to make a code for multi agression. I wanted to use random to make the npc choose a random person but that won’t work. The problem is that it chooses the first person that is near and stays on that one, no matter what. I’ve been trying to find a way to make it choose the closest one, even if it has a target, so like making it change targets. The only way I can think of doing that is using the process() but that would cause a lot of lag. Is there any other way?

Read full topic

item.title: Multi Agression
item.dc:creator: @o.O_O.o o.O O.o
item.description:
@o.O_O.o wrote:

Make it recognize when there are multiple targets within its range, and do some math to figure out its new target, and you probably could use the math in process().

Read full topic

Alright, so I was trying to make a code for multi agression. I wanted to use random to make the npc choose a random person but that won’t work. The only way I can think of doing that is using the process() but that would cause a lot of lag. Is there any other way?
